oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate veteran badge
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate veteran badge with stick pin addition engraved on the back is "Sam Seay/Co. C. 1st Tenn Inf-/C.S.A." This badge predates the United Confederate Veterans and is most likely the Tennessee Division, Association of Confederate Soldiers. Seay was from Davidson County and enlisted in the summer of 1861. He was wounded at Cat Creek on Nov. 26, 1863 after the Confederate defeat at the Battle of Missionary Ridge. He surrendered in Macon, GA on May 4th, 1865.
